{"step_by_step_thinking": "The cavernous sinus is a dural venous sinus in the skull, located laterally to the sella turcica. It contains several cranial nerves, including the oculomotor nerve (III), the ophthalmic nerve (V1), and the maxillary nerve (V2). However, the optic chiasma, which is the X-shaped structure formed by the crossing of the optic nerves, is not located in the lateral wall of the cavernous sinus.", "answer_choice": "C. Optic chiasma"}
